item.description: If we teach by the Spirit and you listen by the Spirit, some one of us will touch on your circumstance.

item.description: President Hinckley teaches about the office of bishop (D&C 72:9-26).

item.title: Sedrick’s Journey
item.description: A young boy in Africa works to earn money to serve a mission.

item.title: I Know That My Redeemer Lives
item.description: A Young Women choir from stakes in Salt Lake City sings “I Know That My Redeemer Lives.”

item.title: War In Heaven
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about the war in heaven. Revelation 12:7-9 ("The Dawning of a Brighter Day," Ensign, May 2004)

item.title: All That the Father Has
item.description: President Faust teaches how we can obtain all that the Father has (D&C 84:33-44).

item.title: Angels Round about You
item.description: Elder Holland teaches how to have angels round about you (D&C 84:86-88).

item.title: The Mailbox
item.description: The Mailbox, 1977 - Every delivery day, 83 year-old Lethe waits at her mailbox for the mailman to arrive.

item.title: Humanitarian Center Film (short)
item.description: An overview of LDS Charities and the work they do all over the world.

item.title: Refugee Relief in Europe: Child Volunteer
item.description: A young boy talks about his desire to serve.

item.title: Refugee Relief in Europe: Gathering Supplies
item.description: A woman talks about her community banding together to provide for the needs of refugees in their area.

item.title: "I knew we were probably losing everything" South Carolina Flooding - Short
item.description: When a flood hit Columbia South Carolina, local members were quick to respond to the needs of the flood victims.

item.title: Mobile Medical Clinic for Refugees in Rome
item.description: In 2015, LDS Charities partnered with MEDU (Doctors for Human Rights–Italy) to fund a mobile medical clinic for refugees in Rome, Italy. Many of these refugees are in transit and are afraid to go to a hospital, so their only option for healthcare is the mobile clinic.

item.title: MEDU Partnership: Sicily
item.description: In 2015, LDS Charities partnered with MEDU (Doctors for Human Rights – Italy) to fund psychological aid as refugees arrived in Sicily, Italy.

item.title: Twin Brothers Helping Refugees
item.description: A pair of young twins gather with members of their congregation to help put together needed items for the recent influx of refugees into the United Kingdom.

item.title: Trisha Leimer—Refugee Relief
item.description: Trisha Leimer talks about her experience with providing relief to refugees in Germany and how she thinks everyone can benefit from giving such service.

item.title: Kirkuk Desk Project
item.description: A social video detailing a community project in Kirkuk.

item.title: Robert Clark—HBB Conference Testimonial
item.description: Robert Clark, an LDS Charities technical specialist, talks about his love for the Helping Babies Breathe program.

item.title: Dean Walker—HBB Testimonial
item.description: Dean Walker, LDS Charities Maternal and Newborn Care program manager, talks about the LDS Charities signature program.

item.title: Annual Report Clean-Water Animation
item.description: A recap of some of the clean-water work that was done by LDS Charities in 2016.

item.title: Not All Meetings Are Useless—Water Committee
item.description: Women in Africa celebrating their involvement in a new water system in their community.

item.title: Does My Donation Make a Difference?
item.description: Ever wonder what happens when you donate an item to a thrift store? Follow the journey of this donated pair of shoes to see all the good giving can do.

item.title: Idaho Falls Community Sees Miracles as They Serve
item.description: At the Idaho Falls Humanitarian Center, people like you dedicate their time and talents to helping others each week. While making quilts, toys, and crochet bereavement outfits for babies, the volunteers themselves feel loved and lifted.

item.title: Zemin Xiao—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Zemin Xiao, the refugee services liaison for Salt Lake County, talks about her experience working with LDS Charities.

item.title: Joseph Nahas—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Joseph Nahas, the refugee capacity building coordinator for the Department of Workforce Services, talks about his experience working with LDS Charities.

item.title: Susan Niermeyer—HBB Conference Testimonial
item.description: Susan Niermeyer, Helping Babies Breathe curriculum editor, talks about the partnership with LDS Charities.

item.title: Eileen Schoen—HBB Conference Testimonial
item.description: Eileen Schoen, manager of the Helping Babies Survive program, talks about the partnership between LDS Charities and the American Academy of Pediatrics.

item.title: Alemnesh Reta—HBB Conference Testimonial
item.description: Alemnesh Reta from Laerdal Global Health talks about the importance of the Helping Babies Breathe program.

item.title: Tony Ryan—HBB Conference Testimonial
item.description: Tony Ryan, neonatologist for Cork University Maternity Hospital, talks about the Helping Babies Breathe program.

item.title: Beena Kamath-Rayne—HBB Conference Testimonial
item.description: Beena Kamath-Rayne, a neonatologist at the Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center, talks about her gratitude for HBB training.

item.title: Lina Smith—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Lina Smith, director of refugee services at the Refugee and Immigrant Center—Asian Association of Utah, talks about her working relationship with LDS Charities.

item.title: Gerald Brown—Refugee Conference Testimonial
item.description: Gerald Brown, director of refugee services for the Department of Workforce Services, talks about his working relationship with LDS Charities.

item.title: Behind the Scenes—International Rescue Committee Inside Look
item.description: We went to the IRC to get a look at their downtown Salt Lake offices and find out about some of the volunteer opportunities they currently have available.

item.title: LDS Charities behind the Scenes—Maternal and Newborn Care Volunteer, Part Two
item.description: Dr. Michael Draper gives us a recap on his trip to Morocco.

item.title: LDS Charities behind the Scenes—Maternal and Newborn Care Initiative Manager
item.description: Dean Walker steps us through some of the training they do in the Maternal and Newborn Care initiative.

item.title: LDS Charities behind the Scenes—Clean Water
item.description: Del Brady, who helps run the clean water initiative, talks to us about how and why we do what we do.

item.title: LDS Charities behind the Scenes—Water Technical Specialists
item.description: Elder and Sister Reynolds explain what goes into a water project and how they train on proper water hygiene.

item.title: LDS Charities Thanks Their 30,000 Followers
item.description: On behalf of LDS Charities, Sharon Eubank thanks their 30,000 Facebook followers.

item.title: JustServe Introduction Video (Civic Version)
item.description: JustServe is a free community resource sponsored as a service by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. The JustServe.org website is used by faith, nonprofit, community, and government organizations use to post service opportunities.

item.title: JustServe Introduction Video
item.description: JustServe is a Church-sponsored initiative with a website (JustServe.org) that various faith, nonprofit, community, and government organizations use to post service opportunities.

item.title: JustServe Community Service Training Video
item.description: Examples of JustServe community service.

category.title: Driven in Detroit: Bridges to Self-Reliance
category.subtitle: Videos: 12

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Organizing an Inner City Welfare Project
item.description: In Detroit, their first step to self-reliance was to identify programs and resources within the Church and community that could be used to help people strengthen their personal storehouse.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Addressing Inner City Welfare Needs
item.description: Church leaders in Detroit called several Church-service missionaries to mentor individuals who wanted to improve their situation and build community partnerships with other nonprofits.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Lamanais Louis on the Road to Self-Reliance
item.description: The Personal Storehouse Project helped Lamanais Louis go back to school to learn about computers. He now uses these skills to refurbish old computers for students in Detroit who cannot afford them.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Bridging the Eight-Mile Divide
item.description: The story of how ward boundaries broke the eight-mile divide—a very real boundary that divides Detroit.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Church Service Missionaries Role
item.description: The Church-service missionaries who mentor in inner-city Detroit build their mentorship on a foundation of friendship and love as they help others achieve their dreams and become more self-reliant.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Watsons, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: The Watsons moved to Detroit to follow an employment opportunity, but then ended up being laid off. Despite the unexpected turn of events, they don't let their challenges keep them from serving.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Delores Hubbard, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Delores’ life was filled with struggle, until the gospel gave her hope. Through the inner-city mission, Delores is working toward helping for recovering addicts and single mothers.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Blacks, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Valerie and Timothy Black are regular volunteers at the local soup kitchen, but several years ago, Brother Black was one of the people visiting the kitchen hoping for a meal.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Parkers, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Although Raechel and Lamar didn't have good role models growing up, with the help of Elder and Sister Utley, they've been able to work towards a better future for themselves and their five children.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Humanitarian Outreach, Winter Clothing Distribution
item.description: The Detroit stake coordinated a Winter Clothing Distribution with community partners.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Solomon Bills, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: After a career as a police officer in the inner-city, Solomon Bills realized that he'd become jaded. Wanting to get rid of these harsh feelings, he began to pray for a change of heart.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Rhodenizers on the Road to Self-Reliance
item.description: Josh and Shauna Rhodenizer came to Detroit for a medical residency and planned to leave shortly afterward, but they made Detroit their permanent home after realizing how much they loved the city.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Maddie Wilson
item.description: Maddie Wilson performs her original song “Freckles” on her guitar. Maddie wrote “Freckles” when she was talking to a friend of hers about how self-conscious she was. “Freckles” is a song about loving yourself how you are.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Leslie Fatai
item.description: Leslie Fatai Nau came to Mormon Channel Studio to share a message that has shaped her life: our joy in life can be limitless if we draw near to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Yahosh Bonner
item.description: In this episode, Yahosh Bonner performs an original song, “Angels Over Me” and one of his favorite hymns, “Savior, Redeemer of My Soul.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - The Kotter Experiment
item.description: The Kotter Experiment visited Mormon Channel Studio to perform an original song, “Let Go,” and an arrangement of the band’s favorite Primary song, “A Child’s Prayer.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Nadia Khristean
item.description: Nadia Khristean performs her original song “Broken” on her piano. The song was inspired by refugees.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Happy Medium
item.description: A group of friends that met in college call themselves Happy Medium. In this episode, Happy Medium performs an original song, “Home and Heart,” followed by their rendition of “I Need Thee Every Hour.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Bianca Merkley and Nicole Sheahan
item.description: Bianca Merkley sings her original song “At the Heart of it.” A song written during her struggle with infertility and miscarriage. She talks about how her relationship with God changed.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Kylie Hintze
item.description: If you’ve wondered whether you’re on the right path in life, you will relate to singer-songwriter Kylie Hintze’s and the original song she performs on this episode of Mormon Channel Studio.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Monica Scott
item.description: Monica Scott plays her original song “For Coey” on the piano accompanied by Sarah Arnesen on the cello. “For Coey” was written for the funeral of a friends son.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Enliven
item.description: The two members of the band Enliven were excused from high school classes in order to perform on this episode of Mormon Channel Studio.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Bri Ray
item.description: Bri Ray performs "Be Still My Soul" and "Holding."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Nik Day
item.description: Nik Day performs "Come, Come, Ye Saints" and "Miracle."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Ashley Hess and Amber Lynn
item.description: Ashley Hess and Amber Lynn perform "The Moment You Stand" and "Higher."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Madilyn Paige
item.description: Accomplished singer Madilyn Paige performs her original song “Irreplaceable” and her rendition of “Nearer, My God, to Thee.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Alex Melecio
item.description: Singer-songwriter Alex Melecio plays a brand-new original song, “What You Knew Then,” on his acoustic guitar. He also sings “Come Follow Me” in Spanish, accompanied on the piano by his wife, Melanie.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Eric Malizia
item.description: Eric Malizia sings "Nearer, My God, to Thee" and an original song for primary children, "100 Ways to Say Jesus."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Aspartame Sunshine
item.description: Listen to Mormon artists share their talents as they share with us an original song and cover of a Hymn.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Danny Heslop
item.description: Danny Heslop performs "Lead Kindly Light" and his original song "Spring."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Jason Lyle Black
item.description: Pianist Jason Lyle Black and violinist Becca Moench perform "Come, Thou Fount" and their original song, "Champs Elysse."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Scott Foster
item.description: Scott Foster performs "As Now We Take the Sacrament" and his original song, "Erase Me."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Jake Lambson
item.description: Pianist Jake Lambson performs "If You Could Hie to Kolob" and an original song.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Firefly
item.description: Sisters Melanie, McKenzie, Madelyn make up the band Firefly, and in this episode they perform an original song, “Home of the Brave,” as well as an arrangement of “The Lord is My Light,” one of their favorites hymns.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Madelyn Hosch
item.description: The songs performed by Madelyn Hosch in this episode of Mormon Channel Studio are all about light. First, she sings an original song called “Sun Sunshine,” followed by a beautiful rendition of “Help Me Teach with Inspiration.”

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Tommy's Mission - Episode 16
item.description: In this episode—the series finale—we watch Tommy prepare for and begin his mission in the Baltic region of Europe. Just when he is ready to give up, everything changes.

item.title: O Holy Night
item.description: The video depicts iconic scenes of our sweet Savior’s birth and the events that surrounded it, as well as touching moments in Jesus Christ’s life when His love and power changed the lives of those He served.

item.title: Love at Home
item.description: There is beauty all around when there's love at home.

item.title: I Pray When... #didyouthinktopray
item.description: People from all over the world submitted #didyouthinktopray photos to remind others to pray anytime about anything.

item.title: Facing Postpartum Anxiety and OCD
item.description: Lindsay was excited to be a new mom, but her feelings of joy and love were instantly overshadowed by postpartum anxiety and obsessive compulsive disorder.

item.title: Moving on from Past Mistakes
item.description: Rachel's self worth was very low after she got pregnant at 16. She talks about her experience going back to high school after giving up her child for adoption.

item.title: Returning to Prayer
item.description: When Mike thought hope, happiness, and even life were over, prayer gave him power to pull through.

item.title: Serving as a Caretaker
item.description: When Shermeka heard that her niece had been abandoned at a local fire station, she made a choice that would change her life forever.

item.title: Taming Technology in the Home
item.description: Technology enables us to be forces for good in the world, but sometimes it distracts us from being present in our families.

item.title: Setting Realistic Expectations with Self, Spouse, and Kids
item.description: Learning when to say “Yes” and how to gracefully say “No” can be key in retaining some of our most important relationships.

item.title: The District: Time to Shine
item.description: Eight Mormon missionaries share their experiences teaching people, and one Elder tells about what led him to serve a mission and leave his rock band behind.

item.title: The District: Brothers and Sisters
item.description: A few Mormon missionaries struggle to find someone to teach. The sister missionaries try to help a family decide on baptism, but when tragedy strikes at home, Sister Voyles has to decide if she should stay or go home.

item.title: The District: Number One
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries find someone to baptize in a man who has already been attending church for the past 30 years. Elder Moreno shares why he left a promising professional soccer career to serve a mission.

item.title: A Great Instrument
item.description: Elder Tuituu, a Mormon missionary, shares his decision to serve a mission and leave his home in Guam. Two Elders hope that a trip to general conference will answer their investigator’s concerns.

item.title: The District: Perfect
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries start teaching John who is living with an LDS family. When John starts dating a member of the family, things get more complicated.

item.title: The District: Saved for a Reason
item.description: When two Mormon missionaries begin teaching a man from China, they find it difficult to get past the cultural and language barriers.

item.title: The District: Turning Point
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries encourage a man who is struggling with a drinking problem. And some Elders find an investigator who loves the missionaries but isn’t too sure about “all the little rules” they live by.

item.title: The District: Coming Home
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries teach a family who is trying to decide if they are ready for a change. And Elder Bott shares how his decision to serve a mission is blessing his family at home.

item.title: Weaving Our Spiritual Tapestry
item.description: Elder Hales explains the importance of creating a strong spiritual tapestry made of a variety of Christ-like characteristics.

item.title: Whatsoever He Saith
item.description: Elder Whitney L. Clayton of the Seventy points out how Mary, the mother of Jesus, was a powerful example of faith and obedience for all of us.

item.title: The Gospel Shall Roll Forth
item.description: A visual depiction of Church growth by stakes (D&C 65).

item.title: Today's Family: Fathers
item.description: Quotes from several members of the First Presidency and the Twelve about the role and importance of fathers.

item.title: Choosing a Self-Reliance Group
item.description: In this dramatized video, learn more about the different self-reliance groups and which group might best fit your situation.

item.title: Choosing a Self-Reliance Group
item.description: In this dramatized video, learn more about the different self-reliance groups and which group might best fit your situation.

item.title: The Power of the Group
item.description: In this dramatized video, see how someone can benefit from the unique setting of a self-reliance group.

item.title: Choosing a Self-Reliance Group
item.description: In this dramatized video, learn more about the different self-reliance groups and which group might best fit your situation.

item.title: Of Regrets and Resolutions
item.description: Quote given by President Dieter F. Uchtdorf in the Saturday morning session on October 6, 2012.

category.title: Starting and Growing My Business (US and Canada)
category.subtitle: Videos: 9

category.title: Chapter 1: My Readiness for Business Success
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Keeping Commitments Leads to Growth
item.description: This video discusses this course's method of learning, in which we work to keep commitments and to support each other as action partners.

item.title: Why Do People Buy?
item.description: This animated video emphasizes the importance of satisfying customer needs.

item.title: Unmet Needs
item.description: A man named Mark is thinking about starting a business. He meets with his friend to identify unmet customer needs.

item.title: Competitive Advantage
item.description: A man named Mark talks with his friend and learns about competitive advantages that he might have in starting his business.

category.title: Chapter 3: Ensuring That I Have a Profitable Business
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Would I Want This Business?
item.description: A student named Sage interviews a couple who owns a mobile oil change business. Sage is trying to determine if the couple has a profitable business.

item.title: Adjusting to Market Change
item.description: A woman named Gabbie is struggling with her tutoring business. She talks with her friend about how to keep her business competitive.

category.title: Chapter 7: Keeping Separate My Business and Personal Money
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Opportunity of a Lifetime? Part 1
item.description: A business owner named Mark explains to his sister why he cannot take money from his business to give her a loan. Part 1 shows Mark’s sister asking him for a loan.

item.title: Opportunity of a Lifetime? Part 2
item.description: A business owner named Mark explains to his sister why he cannot take money from his business to give her a loan. Part 2 explains the importance of separating business and personal money.

item.title: Opportunity of a Lifetime? Part 3
item.description: A business owner named Mark explains to his sister why he cannot take money from his business to give her a loan. Part 3 shows Mark explaining to his sister why he cannot grant her full request.

item.title: Geraldine: He Cares
item.description: Self-reliance principles lead to better jobs for more than one member of this family.

item.title: He Opens Doors
item.description: A couple describes how following the principles of self-reliance impacted their entire family.

item.title: Morales: Meeting Our Potential
item.description: Self-reliance principles sustain a couple through an unexpected employment loss.

item.title: Ronwen: Simple Principles
item.description: We can all improve our self-reliance, even if we don't realize it at first.

item.title: Stephanie: You Can Do It
item.description: After struggling all her life, Stephanie is feeling the help of her Heavenly Father as she improves her education.

item.title: Join Us For October 2017 General Conference
item.description: Join us for His conference. September 23; September 30 – October 1, 2017

item.title: Handel's Messiah: Debtor's Prison
item.description: President Russell M. Nelson taught that the release of these prisoners from debtor’s prison beautifully symbolizes our own redemption through the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: We Believe in Being Chaste
item.description: Quote given by Elder David A. Bednar in the Saturday afternoon on April 6, 2013.

item.title: O Holy Night
item.description: The video depicts iconic scenes of our sweet Savior’s birth and the events that surrounded it, as well as touching moments in Jesus Christ’s life when His love and power changed the lives of those He served.

item.title: What Family Means to Me
item.description: A music video for youth about the meaning and importance of family.

item.title: Gathering God's Family
item.description: Highlights from President Henry B. Eyring's address "Gathering the Family of God" at the April 2017 General Conference.

item.title: What’s Your Family’s Story?
item.description: We learn great lessons from our family stories. Hank Smith shares the story of his in-law’s courtship and explains why it’s important to pass on these stories to our children.

item.title: A Sacrifice of Time
item.description: President Russell M. Nelson and his wife Wendy challenge church members to make the sacrifice of time, that will bring great blessings.

item.title: Gatherers in the Kingdom
item.description: Elder Bradley D. Foster explains each of our roles in gathering God's children on both sides of the veil.

item.title: Enabling Families to Gather Families
item.description: Temple and Family History Consultants are key to enabling the work of Salvation through assisting others in gathering their families on both sides of the veil.

item.title: We are the Lord’s Agents
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook and Elder Dale G. Renlund teach leaders and councils their important role as agents in the work of salvation.

item.title: Families Gathering Families on Both Sides of the Veil
item.description: Each of us has an important role to play in gathering our family on both sides of the veil.

item.title: A Visit from Father
item.description: President Russell M. Nelson recounts a personal family history story that bears testimony of the importance of temple and family history work for all families.

item.title: Printing Family Ordinance Cards from Home
item.description: Learn how to print your family ordinance cards using your home computer.

item.title: Printing Family Ordinance Cards from Home
item.description: Learn how to print your family ordinance cards using your home computer.

item.title: Indexing Guatemala Birth Records
item.description: This video will help you as you index Guatemala Birth Records.

item.title: Today's Family: Fathers
item.description: Quotes from several members of the First Presidency and the Twelve about the role and importance of fathers.

item.title: Message from Brother David L. Beck
item.description: As a faithful priesthood holder, you can bless the lives of those around you; this is the message Brother David L. Beck shares with his story of a boyhood friend from São Paulo, Brazil.

category.title: Featured Training: Learning and Teaching in the Home and Church
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: We Are All Learners and Teachers
item.description: In the Church and in our homes, we all have the responsibility to improve our ability to learn and teach—and to help others do the same.

item.title: Improving Teaching
item.description: In their central role of helping improve gospel learning and teaching, Sunday School presidents can recommend and help provide the Teaching the Gospel course.

item.title: Using Councils to Improve Learning and Teaching
item.description: See examples of the many ways that Sunday School presidents can participate effectively in stake or ward councils to help improve gospel learning and teaching.

item.title: Supporting Those Who Are Called to Teach
item.description: Watch and learn how a Sunday School presidency can orient and support those who have been newly called to teach.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Organizing an Inner City Welfare Project
item.description: In Detroit, their first step to self-reliance was to identify programs and resources within the Church and community that could be used to help people strengthen their personal storehouse.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Addressing Inner City Welfare Needs
item.description: Church leaders in Detroit called several Church-service missionaries to mentor individuals who wanted to improve their situation and build community partnerships with other nonprofits.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Blacks, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Valerie and Timothy Black are regular volunteers at the local soup kitchen, but several years ago, Brother Black was one of the people visiting the kitchen hoping for a meal.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Delores Hubbard, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Delores’ life was filled with struggle, until the gospel gave her hope. Through the inner-city mission, Delores is working toward helping for recovering addicts and single mothers.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Watsons, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: The Watsons moved to Detroit to follow an employment opportunity, but then ended up being laid off. Despite the unexpected turn of events, they don't let their challenges keep them from serving.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Church Service Missionaries Role
item.description: The Church-service missionaries who mentor in inner-city Detroit build their mentorship on a foundation of friendship and love as they help others achieve their dreams and become more self-reliant.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Parkers, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Although Raechel and Lamar didn't have good role models growing up, with the help of Elder and Sister Utley, they've been able to work towards a better future for themselves and their five children.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Humanitarian Outreach, Winter Clothing Distribution
item.description: The Detroit stake coordinated a Winter Clothing Distribution with community partners.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Solomon Bills, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: After a career as a police officer in the inner-city, Solomon Bills realized that he'd become jaded. Wanting to get rid of these harsh feelings, he began to pray for a change of heart.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Lamanais Louis on the Road to Self-Reliance
item.description: The Personal Storehouse Project helped Lamanais Louis go back to school to learn about computers. He now uses these skills to refurbish old computers for students in Detroit who cannot afford them.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Bridging the Eight-Mile Divide
item.description: The story of how ward boundaries broke the eight-mile divide—a very real boundary that divides Detroit.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Rhodenizers on the Road to Self-Reliance
item.description: Josh and Shauna Rhodenizer came to Detroit for a medical residency and planned to leave shortly afterward, but they made Detroit their permanent home after realizing how much they loved the city.

item.title: We Are DI: LDS Humanitarian Center Manager
item.description: Troy oversees everything that happens at the LDS Humanitarian Center, including the ESL program.

item.title: We Are DI: Recycling Manager
item.description: Eric oversees the recycling program at Deseret Industries and makes sure nothing goes to waste.

item.title: We Are DI: Plant Manager, Deseret Manufacturing
item.description: Dan oversees everything that happens at Deseret Manufacturing.

item.title: We Are DI: Truck Driver
item.description: Steve, a truck driver, describes his role at Deseret Industries.

item.title: DI Donations Animation
item.description: Ever wonder what DI can take and what they can't? Well, here are all your answers in one place.

item.title: Deseret Industries—Badge to Badge: Angel
item.description: Angel Cost talks about her experience working with Deseret Industries.

item.title: DI Badge to Badge—Mo Jarmin
item.description: A former Deseret Industries associate, Mo, tells us about his journey at DI.

item.title: Badge to Badge—Erica
item.description: After struggling with a drug addiction, Erica faced the possibility of losing her parental rights. With help from Deseret Industries, Erica has maintained sobriety and has a job as a supervisor.

item.title: Deseret Industries ASOC Introduction
item.description: An introduction for agent stake presidents to the role Deseret Industries plays in their communities,

item.title: Transforming Lives – Mitch Fennemore Story
item.description: Training to be used for Deseret Industries employees.

item.title: Mentor Success – Cory Hanks
item.description: The story of Cory Hanks who mentored Mitch Fennemore in the Deseret Industries program.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Alissa
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Alissa tells us a little bit about herself and her time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Shane
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Shane tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Brad
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Brad tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Adit
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Adit tells us a little bit about herself and her time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Kelis
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Kelis tells us a little bit about herself and her time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Celeste
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Celeste tells us a little bit about herself and her time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Camdin
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Camdin tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Garrett
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Garrett tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Jess
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Jess tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Mathias
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Mathias tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Mark
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Mark tells us a little bit about himself and his time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Sharla
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Sharla tells us a little bit about herself and her time at DI.

item.title: DI Three Questions—Rachelle
item.description: Deseret Industries associate Rachelle tells us a little bit about herself and her time at DI.

item.title: Deseret Industries Street Piano Compilation
item.description: Community members play variations of “The Entertainer” on street pianos donated from Deseret Industries to Salt Lake City.

item.title: Deseret Industries—Piano Painting Time-Lapse
item.description: Watch one of the Deseret Industries street pianos get painted.

item.title: Deseret Industries—Job Coach Piano Music Video
item.description: Four Deseret Industries job coaches play a song together on street pianos donated to Salt Lake City by the D.I.

item.title: Deseret Industries Piano Campaign—Piano Restoration Tutorial
item.description: Watch as DIY blogger Kari shows us how to paint and restore an old piano.

item.title: Deseret Industries Piano Campaign—Mike’s Story
item.description: Mike, an associate at Deseret Industries, tells us his story about how he came to be at DI and what DI has helped him with.

item.title: Deseret Industries Piano Campaign—Kari Call to Action
item.description: Kari, a DIY blogger, tells us the rules for Deseret Industries’ piano giveaway.

category.title: From Crop to Shelf: Behind the Scenes of Welfare
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: Welfare Facilities—Welfare Square
item.description: Welfare Square has a cannery, bakery, milk processing plant, thrift store, and other Church facilities that serve the poor and needy around the world.

item.title: Welfare Facilities—Bishops’ Central Storehouse
item.description: At the Bishops’ Central Storehouse, about 143 different food items are stored in bulk to stock bishops’ storehouses all over the country as well as assist in times of disaster.

item.title: Welfare Facilities—Deseret Mill and Pasta
item.description: Get an inside look at what goes on at Deseret Mill and Pasta.

item.title: Tour of the Harrisville, Utah Welfare Cannery
item.description: Dedicated in May 2017, the Harrisville Utah Cannery cans products that will be delivered to bishops’ storehouses throughout the United States. The food canned will eventually go to help those in need.

item.title: Sharing Gospel Happiness
item.description: A priest finds out his friend has been hospitalized with cancer. His testimony and Christlike example lead her to a knowledge of the truth.

item.title: Message from Brother David L. Beck
item.description: As a faithful priesthood holder, you can bless the lives of those around you; this is the message Brother David L. Beck shares with his story of a boyhood friend from São Paulo, Brazil.

item.title: We Believe in Being Chaste
item.description: Quote given by Elder David A. Bednar in the Saturday afternoon on April 6, 2013.

category.title: March: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Printing Family Ordinance Cards from Home
item.description: Learn how to print your family ordinance cards using your home computer.

category.title: April: The Apostasy and the Restoration
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: A Search for Truth
item.description: Wilford Woodruff's search for the true Church explains the Apostasy and need for the Restoration. It emphasizes four essential elements of the true Church that were lost because of the Great Apostasy.

item.title: Today's Family: Fathers
item.description: Quotes from several members of the First Presidency and the Twelve about the role and importance of fathers.

item.title: A Witness of God
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen describes how all of God's children are pieces of a large puzzle in preparation for the Second Coming of Jesus Christ.

item.title: What Family Means to Me
item.description: A music video for youth about the meaning and importance of family.

item.title: Our Divine Destiny
item.description: Various youth and young adults testify of the importance of recognizing who you are as a child of God and the blessings promised in order to overcome the challenges of life.

item.title: Reach Out and Share
item.description: In April, KSL Television produced this general conference special called "Reach Out and Share." It tells the story of how a family in Arizona joined the Church after watching a Mormon Message for Youth on the Internet called "Dayton's Legs."

item.title: Our Temple in the Amazon
item.description: Youth in Manaus, Brazil, share their excitement and testimonies as they celebrate the dedication of a new temple in their area.
